goal.en: This course aims at providing graduate students and senior undergraduate students who are majoring in mechanical engineering to understand the basics and the state of engineering application of lasers to precision manufacturing, fabrication and material processing.
goal.ch: 提供機械工程背景的研究生與高年級的學士班學生，從應用的角度瞭解雷射的基礎與在精密加工製造、精密製程以及在材料處理等方面的學理與工程應用的狀況。

content.en:
1. Background of Laser Design and General Applications
2. Basics of Laser Optics
3. Laser Cutting, Drilling and Piercing
4. Laser Welding
5. Theory, Mathematical Modeling and Simulation
6. Laser Surface Treatment
7. Laser Additive Manufacturing (LAM) – Laser 3D Printing
8. Laser Ablative Process: Macro- to Micro Processing
9. Laser Bending or Forming
10. Laser Cleaning
11. Laser Glass Processing
content.ch:
1. Background of Laser Design and General Applications
2. Basics of Laser Optics
3. Laser Cutting, Drilling and Piercing
4. Laser Welding
5. Theory, Mathematical Modeling and Simulation
6. Laser Surface Treatment
7. Laser Additive Manufacturing (LAM) – Laser 3D Printing
8. Laser Ablative Process: Macro- to Micro Processing
9. Laser Bending or Forming
10. Laser Cleaning
11. Laser Glass Processing

textbook.en: (1) W. M. Steen and J. Mazumder, “Laser Material Processing,” 4th Ed., Springer, 2010 (2) N. B. Dahotre and S. P. Harimkar, “Laser Fabrication and Machining of Materials,” Springer, 2008. (3) “Laser Processing of Materials, Fundamentals, Applications and Developments” Edited by Peter Schaaf, Springer, 2010. (4) G. G. Gladush and Igor Smurov, “Physics of Laser Materials Processing: Theory and Experiment,” Springer, 2011. (5) M Stafe, A. Marcu, and N. N. Puscas, “ Pulsed Laser Ablation of Solids: Basics Theory and Applications,” Springer 2014 (6) “Non-traditional Micromachining Processes – Fundamentals and Applications,” Edited by Golam Kibria, B. Bhattacharyya and J. Paulo Davim, Springer 2017. (7) “Laser-based Additive Manufacturing of Metal Parts – Modeling, Optimization, and Control of Mechanical Properties,” Edited by Linkan Bian, Nima Shamasei and John M. Usher. CRC Press 2018. (8) Referred journal and conference papers, magazine articles, and patents by topics.
textbook.ch: (1) W. M. Steen and J. Mazumder, “Laser Material Processing,” 4th Ed., Springer, 2010 (2) N. B. Dahotre and S. P. Harimkar, “Laser Fabrication and Machining of Materials,” Springer, 2008. (3) “Laser Processing of Materials, Fundamentals, Applications and Developments” Edited by Peter Schaaf, Springer, 2010. (4) G. G. Gladush and Igor Smurov, “Physics of Laser Materials Processing: Theory and Experiment,” Springer, 2011. (5) M Stafe, A. Marcu, and N. N. Puscas, “ Pulsed Laser Ablation of Solids: Basics Theory and Applications,” Springer 2014 (6) “Non-traditional Micromachining Processes – Fundamentals and Applications,” Edited by Golam Kibria, B. Bhattacharyya and J. Paulo Davim, Springer 2017. (7) “Laser-based Additive Manufacturing of Metal Parts – Modeling, Optimization, and Control of Mechanical Properties,” Edited by Linkan Bian, Nima Shamasei and John M. Usher. CRC Press 2018. (8) Referred journal and conference papers, magazine articles, and patents by topics.
